;一位发言人周二表示，美国共和党总统候选人罗恩·德桑蒂斯已更换了他的竞选经理佛罗里达州州长试图重新启动他的颓势，以在该党 2024 年提名竞选中超越领跑者唐纳德·特朗普。

;

;德桑蒂斯的长期助手佩克 (Generra Peck) 将由詹姆斯·尤斯迈尔 (James Uthmeier) 接任另一位亲密顾问，竞选活动通讯总监安德鲁·罗密欧 (Andrew Romeo) 表示。

;

;四天前，支持德桑蒂斯候选资格的团体的最大个人捐助者表示，除非这位好斗的民粹主义者吸引到更多人，否则他不会捐赠更多资金。更多的捐助者并采取更温和的方式。

;

;德桑蒂斯竞选团队还在 7 月份进行了重大人员变动，裁减了三分之一以上的员工，并对一些中高层管理人员进行了改组。

;< p>;“詹姆斯·尤斯迈尔多年来一直是德桑蒂斯州长的高级顾问之一，在最重要的事情上需要他：与佩克将军和团队其他成员携手合作，让州长处于最佳位置，赢得这场胜利罗密欧在一份声明中说道。

;

;德桑蒂斯在 2024 年 11 月大选中与民主党总统乔·拜登对决的共和党提名竞选中名列第二，但在民意调查中一直在下滑几个月来。

;

;最新的路透社/益普索民意调查显示，他的全国支持率仅为 13%，远远落后于前总统特朗普的 47%。

;

;德桑蒂斯削减了三分之一的总统支持率据一位知情人士透露，大卫·波利安斯基 (David Polyansky) 也将加入德桑蒂斯的竞选团队，他在支持德桑蒂斯的主要外部支出小组中担任高级职务。匿名。

;

;德桑蒂斯将于 8 月 23 日在密尔沃基举行的 2024 年竞选第一场共和党辩论中面临关键时刻。

;

;特朗普表示，他计划跳过这场辩论，这将导致让德桑蒂斯成为其他候选人攻击的焦点。

;为欧盟打造尖端微芯片供应链的努力带来巨大福音台积电周二宣布计划在德国建造一座 100 亿欧元（110 亿美元）的工厂。

;

;该工厂将建在德国东部的德累斯顿，将开始生产用于该公司表示，到 2027 年底将进入汽车行业。

;

;该项目标志着全球领先的先进芯片制造商台积电首次进军欧洲市场。该公司将与德国公司罗伯特·博世 (Robert Bosch) 和英飞凌科技 (Infineon Technologies) 以及荷兰恩智浦半导体 (NXP Semiconductors) 合作。

;

;欧洲政治领导人多年来一直向台积电示好，因为欧盟试图避免各种供应-在冠状病毒大流行期间，链条瓶颈导致部分经济瘫痪。

;

;该集团一直在寻找吸引台湾芯片投资的方法，而不与台湾自治岛政府达成重大交易。

;

;美国和欧洲对中国传统芯片生产越来越感到担忧

;

;布鲁塞尔对台北提出的就双边投资协议展开谈判的要求不为所动，欧盟官员公开辩称，自由流动的投资表明不需要达成协议。

;

;不过，他们私下承认，他们担心来自中国的报复。 2016年，布鲁塞尔承诺与中国、香港和台湾单独谈判投资协议。但在人权制裁方面发生争执后，欧盟-中国全面投资协议 (CAI) 陷入了地缘政治炼狱。

;

;虽然这一问题仍未解决，但布鲁塞尔官僚们甚至不愿意提出与台湾签订协议的想法。有观点认为，让所有 27 个欧盟成员国都支持与台湾达成正式贸易或投资协定是​​不可能的。

;

;对于德国来说，台积电的交易为其萎靡不振的工业注入了一剂强心剂。发动机——但要付出代价。德国媒体报道称，政府将为该工厂提供 50 亿欧元的补贴。

;

;在此之前，英特尔宣布计划在德国东部另一座城市马格德堡建设一座价值 300 亿欧元的芯片工厂，该市拥有三分之一的产能。预计政府补贴将覆盖成本。

;

;欧盟称，柏林正在利用布鲁塞尔宽松的国家援助规则，而其疲弱的经济预计今年仅增长 0.3%数据估计。周日，欧盟最大经济体德国的工业生产 6 月份的跌幅超出了经济学家的预期。

;

;该协议还提升了欧盟建设本土半导体行业的努力，因为它希望避开中美科技战，并在未来台湾海峡出现中断的情况下支撑自己的芯片供应。

;

;自 18 个月前俄罗斯入侵乌克兰以来，大量政治资本已投入到使欧盟的供应链更具弹性。作为这一策略的一部分，它希望减少对中国和其他贸易伙伴在关键技术方面的依赖。

;

;现在，来自欧盟成员国的金融资本也开始效仿。台积电的投资是在欧盟最终批准《芯片法案》两周后进行的，该法案旨在“到 2030 年将欧盟在半导体领域的全球市场份额翻一番，从现在的 10% 增加到至少 20%”。

;

;芯片哎哟！日本在台北的帮助下为国产半导体注入活力

;

;“对台积电决定与欧盟 3 家主要半导体公司一起投资在欧盟建立新的半导体工厂感到非常高兴，”欧盟内部市场负责人蒂埃里·布雷顿 (Thierry Breton) 在社交媒体上发帖。

;

;“这是正在实施的《欧盟芯片法案》——为欧洲（包括欧盟汽车行业）带来更强的供应安全，”布雷顿补充道。

;

;其他欧盟国家官员们语气谨慎，指出台积电在美国亚利桑那州的新工厂推迟开业的部分原因是缺乏熟练工人。他们指出，鉴于这项工作的技术性很强，而且工厂即将在世界各地涌现，因此需要认真考虑技能培训。

;

;德国的风险合作伙伴将创建欧洲半导体制造公司 (European Semiconductor Manufacturing Company) 是一个新实体，其晶圆厂（制造工厂的行业简写）将由台积电 (TSMC) 运营。

;

;巴黎蒙田研究所 (Institut Montaigne) 亚洲项目主任 Mathieu Duchatel 表示，这一消息有利于德国和欧洲的工业雄心，但表明将欧盟芯片生产市场份额翻一番的目标仍然不现实。

;

;“欧盟芯片法案授权豁免国家援助禁令，如果企业和“政府证明晶圆厂项目是‘同类首创’，这是一个宽松的概念，大大放松了欧盟臭名昭著的严格竞争法，”他最近在欧盟新闻门户网站 Euractiv 上发表的一篇文章中写道。

;

;其他此类投资包括位于意大利西西里岛的一家碳化硅衬底工厂，以及位于法国的一家为高科技芯片工程生产超薄硅技术的工厂。

;

;故事：如果没有欧盟芯片法案，这些投资就不可能在欧洲进行，但它们不足以增加欧洲相对于台湾的市场份额。半导体设备支出的趋势往往表明台湾和韩国的进步实际上仍在增加。”杜查特尔写道。

;“敌对行为者”在一次涉及黑客访问的复杂网络事件中针对英国选举委员会该委员会周二表示，内部电子邮件和选民数据副本。

;

;“今天我们宣布，我们已成为复杂网络攻击的目标，我们的系统被敌对行为者访问，”该独立机构在推特上表示.

;

;选举委员会是监督选举和监管政治金融的独立机构，该委员会表示，黑客于 2021 年 8 月首次访问其系统，该事件于 2022 年 10 月被发现。

;

;“我们很遗憾花了这么长时间才发现。”

;

;苏纳克的保守党保住了鲍里斯·约翰逊的席位，但在两个关键选区惨遭失败

;

;它解释说，它需要采取补救措施在公开事件之前，采取的措施包括阻止黑客访问、评估事件的严重程度以及采取“额外的安全措施”。

;

;它没有透露攻击者的名字，他们有权访问以下服务器：持有其电子邮件、控制系统和包含数百万选民详细信息的选举登记册副本。

;

;此外，该公司表示，该事件表明英国的民主机构仍然是黑客的目标。他们可以访问保存其电子邮件、控制系统和选举登记册副本的服务器。

;

;自从美国官员发现俄罗斯干预 2016 年总统选举以来，选举安全已成为许多国家的一个关键问题。推动唐纳德·特朗普的白宫竞选活动。

;

;英国议会委员会在 2020 年表示，俄罗斯干预了 2014 年苏格兰独立公投，同时指出了对英国退欧公投进行类似干预的指控。

;

;选举委员会首席执行官肖恩·麦克纳利在一份声明中表示：“我们知道敌对行为者可以访问哪些系统，但无法最终确定哪些文件可能被访问或未被访问。”成功的攻击……凸显出参与选举的组织仍然是目标，并且需要对选举过程中的风险保持警惕。”

;

;登记册中的大部分数据 - 包括这些组织的姓名和地址该委员会补充说，2014 年至 2022 年间登记投票的信息以及海外选民的姓名已经进入公共领域。

;

;英国去年 11 月成立了一个部长级工作组，以应对外国干预其选举的威胁，而最近通过的国家安全法对此类违法行为规定了更严厉的处罚。

;

;选举委员会已与英国国家网络安全中心 (NCSC) 和外部专家合作调查该事件，并随后对相关问题进行了改进它表示，其 IT 系统的安全性。

;反性暴力危机中心敦促香港隐私监管机构提供更大的保护RainLily 周二表示，从 2021 年 4 月到 2023 年 3 月，它收到了 646 份与图像性暴力相关的援助请求。它已帮助个人要求在线平台删除 1,342 张未经同意的亲密内容照片。其中近 1,200 张（即 89%）最终被删除。

;

;但是，RainLily 透露了帮助受害者删除图像的各种挑战。

;< p>;该非政府组织表示，与其他平台相比，色情网站上发布的内容以“指数级规模”传播，25 个网站从未对非政府组织做出回应，也没有采取删除行动。

;大多数网站只禁止侵犯所有者版权的材料。但未经同意的亲密图像的版权大部分属于“摄影师”，这给彻底删除此类内容带来了困难。

;报告遭受网络性骚扰的男性多于女性：调查

;

;“虽然这些平台有政策和举报渠道，但他们不回应和举报Kan 说。

;由城市公司建造的香港首辆电动小巴将于作为推动绿色交通的一部分，将于今年年底推出。

;

;信兴新能源董事总经理周二表示，其价值 200 万港元（256,000 美元）的 Moonca 模型是第一个获得环境保护部批准的模型Department，旨在打入新兴的电动小巴市场。

;

;信兴集团子公司的负责人 Gary Ng Fuk-keung 补充道，这款新车是不可避免的赚钱起点迈向电动公共交通。

;

;“我们希望打入小巴市场。这是大势所趋，香港的小巴迟早都会转为电动车。”吴说。

;

;“每辆小巴的售价约为200万港元。预计今年年底交付首批车辆。”

;

;信兴集团是香港最大的电器分销商之一。

;

;该集团的生产推广电动小巴是该署斥资 8,000 万港元推广电动公共小巴试验计划的一部分。

;

;政府在一年内资助了 40 辆电动小巴，涵盖了 80% 的成本。< /p>;

;Those who missed out on the scheme can take advantage of the New Energy Transport Fund to get 50 per cent funding.

;

;Hong Kong tax breaks fuel big switch to electric cars, but where to charge them?

;

;Moonca, a 19-seater vehicle run by a high-efficiency lithium-titanate battery, is a joint venture by Shun Hing New Energy and Guangtong Automobile, a subsidiary of mainland firm Gree Altairnano New Energy .

;

;The vehicles can be charged through pantographs, a rooftop array connected to wires, or at charging stations, and batteries can be at 90 per cent capacity in about 18 minutes.

;

;A 10 minute charge is equivalent to 50km (31 miles) on the roads.

;

;Ng said the group was ready for mass production but operators might need to wait for the government to install more elevated charging spots at some interchange stations over next year.

;

;“Under the pilot scheme, we aim to produce about 20 Mooncas in about one year,” he said. “Of course, we hope to attract as many buyers as possible and get more orders when operators realise that our model will do good for their business.”

;Accelerate the drive towards electric cars

;

;The minibus pilot scheme was introduced after the government in 2021 set out its goal for carbon neutrality by 2050 to protect the environment.

;

;It unveiled a road map designed to popularise electric vehicles and phase out new purchases of internal combustion engine cars by 2035.

;

;The government said it would set out a timetable for the adoption of electric commercial vehicles in 2025 and was looking at carrying out trials for green public transport and haulage vehicles.

;

;Hong Kong has about 4,146 minibuses at present, including 3,299 green minibuses and 847 red ones.

;The government in 2018 introduced a range of tax breaks to encourage private car owners to trade in internal combustion engine vehicles for greener alternatives.

;

;Tesla by last year was the most popular brand bought under the tax break scheme, accounting for 23,820 of the total, or 70 per cent, followed by Mercedes-Benz with 3,174 and BMW at 1,750.

;

;Hong Kong had 50,665 registered electric private cars in February this year, a big jump from 28,742 a year ago.

;

;Official statistics showed electric-powered vehicles amounted to 7.8 per cent of the city's private cars.

;

;But there were only 5,434 EV chargers in public and private locations at the end of last year, a ratio of about one charger for every 10 vehicles.

;Mainland China's Huanggang checkpoint will speed up its processing of travellers with a dual aim of shortening the time spent in immigration and contributing to Hong Kong's innovation and technology (I&T) development, a top Shenzhen official has said.

;

;Wang Gang, chief of the Shenzhen Exit and Entry Port Office, on Tuesday said visitors entering mainland China through the facility would only need to have their identity documents inspected once, instead of the double check carried out at most other crossings.

;

;The changes will be achieved through a co-location arrangement, which combines immigration clearance for the mainland and Hong Kong under one roof. The facility is currently closed and expected to finish renovations in 2026.

;

;Wang, speaking to mainland media, also pointed to the checkpoint's importance within the Lok Ma Chau Loop, which will be home to the Hong Kong-Shenzhen Innovation and Technology Park.

;

;“The core of the development of 'one zone, two parks' relies on the new Huanggang port,” said Wang, referring to the name used to describe the area that also includes the Shenzhen/Hong Kong Innovation and Technology Co-operation Zone.

;

;“The transformation of a port can free up more land and release more space, allowing for further expansion and growth in these technology innovation zones.”

;

;'Hong Kong should copy Macau for quicker border clearance with simple check'

;

;Hong Kong will be able to close the Lok Ma Chau control point under the arrangements, freeing up more land to develop the San Tin Technopole – a proposed I&T cluster in the north of the city.

;

;Huanggang is currently connected to Lok Ma Chau, one of Hong Kong's 14 border checkpoints with the mainland.

;

;Wang's comments follow Secretary for Security Tang Ping-keung's confirmation in May that the two cities had agreed to the co-location arrangement at the checkpoint and were actively exploring the implementation of “collaborative inspection and joint clearance” procedures there.

;

;The work of inspection units from both sides would not change significantly, but the clearance time for the public would be shorter, Wang said.

;

;The mainland official also announced the Shenzhen side of the Lo Wu checkpoint would implement a frequent traveller programme to speed up the processing of regular users of the facility such as students, businessmen and technology professionals.

;

;He did not reveal a timeline for implementing the programme.

;

;The Lo Wu checkpoint had been the busiest border checkpoint since the mainland and Hong Kong resumed quarantine-free travel at the beginning of the year, with 23 million people passing through, according to Wang.

;

;Hong Kong proposes streamlining immigration at Northern Metropolis checkpoint

;

;Futian came second with 21 million visitors in the past seven months, followed by Shenzhen Bay, the West Kowloon high-speed rail terminus, Liantang-Heung Yuen Wai and Man Kam To.

;

;Wang pointed out that many people from both cities had an emotional attachment to the mainland side of the Lo Wu checkpoint as it symbolised Shenzhen's opening up and reform in 1980. The facility would be preserved, allowing people to experience collective cultural memories, he said.

;

;Hong Kong explores easier cross-border travel for talent to spur I&T hub growth

;

;Counters had been set up at various ports to make it easier to exchange yuan and encourage more Hong Kong residents to spend in Shenzhen, Wang said.

;

;QR codes are also on display to help users download mobile payment applications, while free Wi-fi has been installed in the surrounding areas.

;

;Meanwhile, Wang's office announced 18 new arrangements to facilitate passenger clearance on its official WeChat account. The measures include providing free consultation services, mobile phone charging stations and luggage trolleys.

;China's Big Tech firms, start-ups and institutions are rushing to share with the rest of the world their large language models (LLMs) – the software that underpins chatbots like ChatGPT – as they race to acquire global users amid a competition over artificial intelligence (AI) supremacy.

;

;The Beijing Academy of Artificial Intelligence (BAAI), a government-backed facility focused on foundational AI research and its application in areas from medical use to life science, became the latest major Chinese player to open source a new AI model when it made its BGE model freely available for commercial use on Tuesday.

;

;In June, the academy also opened up its Aquila model, which had been pre-trained on 7 billion parameters, 40 per cent of them Chinese and 60 per cent English, according to the model's profile introduction on Github.

;

;A model's capability hinges partly on its number of parameters.例如，OpenAI 的 ChatGPT 接受了 1750 亿个参数的训练。 While most open-sourced Chinese LLMs right now have between 6 and 13 billion parameters, BAAI said it planned to launch a more advanced version of Aquila with 33 billion parameters.

;

;BAAI's moves come as the cloud unit of Alibaba Group Holding, owner of the South China Morning Post, last week open-sourced two 7-billion-parameter AI models, based on its flagship Tongyi Qianwen LLM launched in April.

;

;Available on both Alibaba's own repository ModelScope and US platform Hugging Face, the two models can be used by scholars, researchers and companies free of charge.

;

;Open-sourcing is a way for players such as Alibaba and BAAI to extend their reach in the sector, according to experts.

;

;“So far, everyone is enthusiastic and there have been lots of LLM products launched by various companies amid an intensified competition, but the models are more or less at the same level,” said Zhang Yi, founder and chief analyst at consultancy iiMedia.

;

;“Open-sourcing a large [AI] model is a strategy [to stand out],” he said.

;

;That could be especially true for lesser-known companies. Baichuan, the AI start-up founded by Wang Xiaochuan, founder and CEO at Chinese search engine Sogou, in June announced the open-sourcing of its 13-billion-parameter Baichuan-13B model.

;

;Beijing-based start-up Zhipu AI said in June it would open source its ChatGLM2-6B model, which has 6 billion parameters.

;

;“I think open-sourcing by itself is also a business model … Companies, big or small, that choose to open source their large [AI] models, hope to reap certain business benefits,” Li Dahai, CEO at Beijing-based AI start-up Modelbest, said in an interview with the Post in June.

;

;In China, a debate on whether money can be made from ChatGPT fever

;

;Many companies want to deploy the computing power of LLMs without training a model themselves – a process that entails exorbitant expenses, according to Lin Yonghua, deputy head and chief engineer at BAAI.

;

;“It's costly to reinvent the LLM wheels: not only are computing power and data expensive, the process also uses lots of electricity and energy,” Lin told Chinese media in June.

;

;Modelbest's Li said open-sourcing provides a low-cost way for the company to reach out to potential clients and allow them to get a sense of the firm's technological capability. “It's a very good [way to find] sales leads,” he said.

;

;Modelbest, which open sourced its 10-billion-parameter Chinese-English bilingual CPM-Bee foundational AI model in May, said it had received applications from more than 100 companies to use it for free.
